data.question: What is the main focus of the study described in the article?
data.answer: The main focus of the study is the one-dimensional assembly of chalcogenide nanoclusters with bifunctional covalent linkers.

data.question: What types of ligands are used as directional linkers in the assembly of chalcogenide nanoclusters?
data.answer: Bifunctional ligands, specifically different types of bipyridines, are used as the directional linkers.

data.question: What is the significance of the integer 'q' in the notation COV-q?
data.answer: The integer 'q' indicates a particular structure type in the notation COV-q.

data.question: Under what conditions were all the materials reported in the study synthesized?
data.answer: All materials were synthesized under solvothermal conditions between 85 and 150 °C.

data.question: What is the role of the terminal pyridyl group in the COV-1 (Cd32S14(SPh)36L4) cluster?
data.answer: The terminal pyridyl group acts as a ligand in the COV-1 cluster.

data.question: How does the maximum absorption wavelength change with the size of the clusters used as building blocks?
data.answer: The maximum absorption wavelength is red-shifted to longer wavelengths when larger clusters are used as building blocks.

data.question: What determines the optical properties of the materials in the study?
data.answer: The optical properties of the materials are determined by the size of the semiconducting nanoclusters used as building blocks.

data.question: Why are Cd-17 and Cd-8 clusters only able to form singly bridged chains?
data.answer: Cd-17 and Cd-8 clusters can only form singly bridged chains because they use only two corners for cross-linking due to their -2 charge.

data.question: What is the effect of using different lengths and rigidity of organic ligands in the assembly process?
data.answer: Using organic ligands of various lengths and rigidity allows for the creation of organized nanocluster-ligand structures through synthetic design.

data.question: How does the assembly of Cd-32 clusters differ in COV-1 and COV-2?
data.answer: In COV-1, Cd-32 clusters are joined through two TMDPy ligands into doubly bridged chains, while in COV-2, they are joined through one TMDPy molecule into singly bridged chains.

data.question: What causes the red-shift in optical absorption for the materials?
data.answer: The red-shift in optical absorption is caused by the use of larger clusters as building blocks, leading to longer wavelength absorption.

data.question: Why is COV-2 the only covalent superstructure containing separate cationic and anionic components?
data.answer: COV-2 contains separate cationic and anionic components because the replacement of only two -SPh corners by neutral ligands decreases the charge on each Cd-32 cluster from -4 to -2, requiring void space to accommodate charge-balancing cations.
